screenshot.alt: Screenshot of a .ws file in Microsoft Visual Studio Code
screenshot.caption: WS file open in Microsoft Visual Studio Code

description: The Windows Script Host is a tool that system administrators can use to automate a variety of login and administrative actions. To do so, administrators create and run Windows Scripts, which may be saved as WS files.

WS files are plain text files. Notably, WS files can include routines written using JScript, VBScript, BASIC, Perl, Python, and many other programming languages. To create WS files, administrators use Microsoft Notepad, Microsoft Visual Studio Code, or another text editor.
NOTE: Windows Scripts are more commonly saved as .WSF files.
